meanings.definition: In a manner that shows excessive willingness to serve or please others.
meanings.sent1: She smiled obsequiously at her boss, hoping for a promotion.
meanings.sent2: The waiter bowed obsequiously as he took their orders.
meanings.sent3: The dog wagged its tail obsequiously, hoping for a treat.
meanings.sent4: The politician spoke obsequiously to gain the support of the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The student nodded obsequiously, eager to impress the teacher.

meanings.definition: Showing excessive willingness to serve or please others.
meanings.sent1: The obsequious waiter hovered around the table, anticipating their needs.
meanings.sent2: She received praise for her obsequious behavior towards the guests.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave an obsequious purr when offered a treat.
meanings.sent4: His obsequious attitude towards authority figures was evident in his actions.
meanings.sent5: The obsequious employee always agreed with his superiors, never voicing his own opinions.
